page.title: Bosnia and Herzegovina national under-21 football team

revisions.rev:
{{Refimprove|date=August 2010}} {{Infobox National football team | Name = Bosnia and Herzegovina U-21 | Badge = | FIFA Trigramme = BIH | Nickname = Zmajevi (Dragons)
Ljiljani (Lilies) | Association = [[Football Association of Bosnia and Herzegovina]] | Coach = {{Flagicon|Bosnia and Herzegovina}} Vlado JagodiÄ | pattern_la1= _depor0910h |pattern_b1=_BiH_Home |pattern_ra1= | pattern_sh1=_adidaswhite | leftarm1=FFFFFF |body1=FFFFFF |rightarm1=FFFFFF |shorts1=1C57A5 |socks1=FFFFFF | pattern_la2=_shoulder_stripes_white_stripes_half |pattern_b2= _BiH_Away |pattern_ra2= _shoulder_stripes_white_stripes_half |pattern_sh2=_adidaswhite | pattern_so2=_3_stripes_white | leftarm2=1C57A5 |body2=1C57A5 |rightarm2=1C57A5 |shorts2= 1C57A5 |socks2=1C57A5 }} '''Bosnia and Herzegovina U21 national football team''' is a youth team of Bosnia and Herzegovina that represents the country in the [[UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|European Under-21 Football Championship]] and friendly matches. They have been in the qualifications for the European Championship 7 times but not yet managed to reach the final tournament. In 2006 they played [[Czech Republic]] in the playoffs for the final tournament in [[The Netherlands|Holland]] 2007 but failed, the Czechs won 2:1 at home and the result was 1:1 in [[Sarajevo]]. One of the most memorable results of the Bosnia and Herzegovina U-21 team was on October 10, 2002. [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germanys U-21]] team was defeated with 5:1 in [[Zenica]] at the [[Bilino Polje]] stadium. On the 10th May, the Committee for the normalization of the Bosnian football federation appointed Vlado JagodiÄ as Head Coach.http://www.reprezentacija.ba/top-vijest/4760-vlado-jagodi-novi-selektor-mlade-reprezentacije.html == UEFA U21 Championship Record == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Year !width="90"|Round !width="20"|GP !width="20"|W !width="20"|D !width="20"|L !width="20"|GS !width="20"|GA |- |{{flagicon|ROM}} [[1998 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|1998]] |colspan="8"|''Did Not Qualify'' |- |{{flagicon|SVK}} [[2000 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|2000]] |colspan="8"|''Did Not Qualify'' |- |{{flagicon|SUI}} [[2002 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|2002]] |colspan="8"|''Did Not Qualify'' |- |{{flagicon|GER}} [[2004 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|2004]] |colspan="8"|''Did Not Qualify'' |- |{{flagicon|POR}} [[2006 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|2006]] |colspan="8"|''Did Not Qualify'' |- |{{flagicon|NED}} [[2007 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|2007]] |colspan="8"|''Did Not Qualify'' |- |{{flagicon|SWE}} [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|2009]] |colspan="8"|''Did Not Qualify'' |- |{{flagicon|DEN}} [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|2011]] |colspan="8"|''Did Not Qualify'' |- |{{flagicon|ISR}} [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship|2013]] |colspan="8"| |- |'''Total''' |colspan="8"|0/8 |} ==UEFA U21 Euro 2013 Qualifiers== {{Main|2013 UEFA European Underâ21 Football Championship qualification Group 1}}{{2013 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship qualification Group 1 |expanded=yes |fixtures=yes |tiebreakers=yes}}
